result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton M. Everson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programs as prescribed by agent.  Follow all rules of the agent.

Submit DNA sample (this has been ordered also in 14CF50; the surcharge has been entered in that case).

0 days credit in the event of revocation, as stipulated to by the DA and Defense.
Concurrent with: Probation concurrent with 14CF50 but consecutive to prison sentence Defendant is presently serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
14CF18 and 14CF50/sentencing after revocation. Defendant Dalton M. Everson in court, in custody, with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA asks Court to adopt recommendation of the agent (sentences for these matters to be concurrent with imposed sentence after revocation in 10CF42 case). No objection from the Defense. Challenge Incarceration and ERP eligibility confirmed as Def is 25 years old. 

Sentence: 

10CF42 was already imposed. Nothing further needed or ordered.
14CF50 - all four counts - 9 months jail each, all concurrent and concurrent with 10CF42 and 14CF18; costs converted to civil jgt
14CF18 - 6 months jail, concurrent with 10CF42 and 14CF50; costs converted to civil jgt
Credit, to be indicated the same on all cases, as all are concurrent: Court asks State and Defense to work on that issue and come to an agreeable number. Atty. L asks for 222. DA asks for 230. Parties stipulate to 230 days credit via stipulation.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 2, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Revocation Order and Warrant indicates it is for 10CF42, 14CF18, and 14CF50. 10CF42 had an imposed/stayed sentence. Although the agent states recommendations for sentencing after rev in 10CF42, such is not necessary because the sentence in the event of revocation has already been determined. Agent Popp concedes this to be the case and withdraws his request for sentencing after revocation in 10CF42. 14CF18 and 14CF50 remain before the Court for sentencing after revocation. Civil judgments for unpaid costs will be entered in all three matters in accordance with the JOC's and the up-to-date financial information provided by DOC in the rev order/warrant.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: one doc for 2 cases (14cf18 & 14Cf50)
1 doc for 2 cases - filed and scanned in 14CF50

DA Harper for the State.  Def, in custody, with Atty. McDougal for the Defense.  DA advises the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution in both 14CF50 and 14CF18, on the calendar for status today.

DA states the agreement whereby informations are filed with 2 counts (felony bail jumping and misd. theft) in 14CF18 and 4 counts (1 felony bail jumping and 3 counts of misd. 4th degree sex. assault) in 14CF50.  DA details the agreement:  def to enters pleas to all counts in 14CF50 and to count 1 in 14CF18.  State offers dismissal/read-in of count 2 in 14CF18.  Agreement calls for a sentence withheld for probation of 2 yrs to the misdemeanors, consecutive to the prison sentence def is presently serving.  For the felonies, DA asks for 4 yrs probation concurrent with other probation but consecutive to present sentence with conditions of no contact with victim in the complaint except as allowed by agent; payment of child support if any ordered by any court; costs/fees.

Atty. M asks for costs only on the felonies.

Colloquies conducted on waiver of prelims.  Informations filed.

Def pleads no contest to counts 1-4 in 14CF50 and to count 1 in 14CF18.  Colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Court rules on sentence:
14CF18 - 4 years probation consecutive to sentence now serving.  Count 2 dismissed/read-in.
14CF50 - Count 1 - 4 years probation consecutive to sentence now serving, concurrent with all probation.  Counts 2-4, sentence:  2 years probation on each count, concurrent, consecutive to sentence now serving.

Conditions of all:  no contact with victim in 14CF50, except as allowed by agent; pay child support as determined by court in the future; in both cases, attend, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment or programs as prescribed by agent; follow all rules of agent; one set of costs imposed in each case with payment of those as condition of probation.  Submit DNA sample if required by DOC.  DNA surcharge to be applied on the felonies but not misdemeanors.  

As convicted felon, Court provides admonishments including lifetime firearm prohibition.

0 days credit as stipulated by parties.
Status conference on January 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

DA Harper, Def in custody and with Atty. McDougal for adjourned initial in 14CF50 and status in 14CF18.  11CF92 called as well (was not on the calendar).

11CF92 - DA moves to vacate the DPA.  Atty. McDougal - Defense does not contest the motion to revoke the DPA.  Court revokes the DPA and asks for comments on sentencing.  DA asks for 120 days, consecutive to any sentence def may be serving; notes def is presently in prison and the 120 days would be served in prison.  Atty. McDougal agrees with DA.  Court sentences def to 120 days incarceration, consecutive to any sentence already serving; will be served in prison consecutive to the sentence he's already serving.  Good time.  Costs also ordered - felony court costs with DNA surcharge remitted.  Felony admonishments given.

14CF18 and 14CF50 - initial appearances:  Formal reading waived.  Rights stated.  Prelim time limits waived and colloquys conducted.

Status requested and set in both cases for Jan. 14, 2015 at 11 a.m.  Atty. M states that she and DA would prefer a non-criminal-Wed date to allow more time for these matters.  Court resets to Friday, Jan. 16 at 11 - 1 hour.  Status conference scheduled for 01-16-2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Lisa A. McDougal in court for Defendant Dalton M. Everson. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper reports def is no longer in custody in Sauk, unable to serve order to produce. Requests rescheduling.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

DA Harper and Atty. McDougal.  Def is in Sauk Co. Jail and was not transported here today for this appearance.  DA asks for setover.  Atty. M requests 9-11 at 3.  So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for 09-11-2014 at 03:00 pm.

DA, Def, and Atty. M.  DA states that the parties are working towards resolution; notes that the def is presently on probation and doing well.  This matter was scheduled for prelim today.  Atty. M asks that the next date be set as a status so that witness are not brought in.  Def has waived time limits for the prelim.  Next date set as status, as requested. Defendants...

SP Conlon for the State, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Formal reading waived.  Rights stated.  Atty. M requests prelim, time limits having been waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State appears by DA Harper, DE appears in person and w/o counsel. Court reads charges/max penalties to defendant. Court's colloqy on def's rights to attorney. Def is instructed to contact Pub Def office and report back. Matter is adjourned at 1:28. DE reports back that he qualifies for Pub Def.

Matter is set for Adj Init Appr on 03-19-2014 @ 10 a.m.
